results.title: Julie, your best just isn't good enough
results.brief_description: Julie left school early and as been in and out of jobs for four years. She has been unemployed for tem months and is willing to take any job. She talks about the dole, what she does with her money and about her parents.

results.title: Do I have to kill my child?
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Janet Isaac, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A program which dramatises the anguish and desperation of parents who turn baby-bashers. Jackie Weaver plays Dianne, a young, middle class mother whose ability to cope with children, neighbours, the housework and upward-mobile husband and all the stresses of modern living suddenly gives way. A warm, dramatic film about a very real problem in contemporary society. Cast include: Jacki Weaver, Brendon Lunney, Willie Fennell.

results.title: In praise of hands
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A tribute to the craftsmen everywhere whose work adds colour and richness to life. Filmed in the Canadian Arctic, Finland, India, Nigeria, Japan, Mexico, and Poland, it shows the special skills of artisans working at their crafts - stone sculpture, pottery, ceramics, weaving, dyeing, puppet making, embroidery. Each indigenous skill is a reflection of the culture of the country. Film without words. (Award: Moscow)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Winkler, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Let's draw with crayons
results.brief_description: Elementary school children demonstrate several methods of using crayons artistically. Various techniques of application, shading, blending and using crayons are illustrated. Methods of creating designs for arts and crafts, textiles and posters are included. Good and bad drawing techniques are compared and hints made on the care of crayons.

results.title: Splash
results.brief_description: A home swimming pool, an accidental drowning, a distraught and helpless mother. Such tragedies can be prevented. A poolside seminar demonstrates the dangers and the means of avoiding them, emphasising the need for awareness and the knowledge of basic methods of resuscitation.

results.title: Autumn of a mining town
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Perhaps due to its fascinating past and equally astonishing present, the Victorian gold rush town of Ballarat catches the quintessence of Victorian Australia - the curious old homes; the old tramcars; the coffee palace; the Cobb & Co office; the gardens and the people. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cigarettes and matches
results.creator_credit: Jerry Elder and Jerry Elder Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a chapter from the book “The Sun on the Stubble” by Colin Thiele. Evokes the Australian country and the people of the 1920’s by highlighting the relationships between members of a farming family and their friends. Cast includes Michael Moody, Timothy Edwards, Hetty Rollings, John Remynse. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Orthogonal projection (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allen Downs, Art Landy, Don Gangloff, Jay Hines and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Introduces an elementary transformation involving triangles transformed into a problem involving conics. Uses certain fundamental geometric notions such as division of line segments into given ratios, in variance under transformations, conic sections etc. which are encountered in other parts of geometry.
